node.title: How bats are keeping their cool during heatwaves in Western Sydney
node.alt: A group of flying foxes hanging upside-down in trees.
node.description: More than 70,000 grey-headed flying foxes perished from heat stress during the Black Summer of 2019, pushing them onto the endangered register. Now, researchers are finding new ways to chill their roosting spots.
node.content:
["The heatwave and drought conditions that fuelled the 2019 Black Summer bushfires proved catastrophic not just for humans but for some of the state's\u00a0most vulnerable wildlife populations.", "More than 70,000 grey-headed flying foxes perished from heat stress during the punishingly hot summer, pushing them onto the endangered\u00a0animal register where they are now listed as a vulnerable species.", "Volunteers and wildlife experts in Western Sydney, where temperatures reached as high as 49 degrees Celsius, were at a loss to prevent the disaster from happening.", "", "
Greater Sydney Parklands environment manager, David Kirkland, checks on the flying foxes.\u00a0(ABC News.)
", "", "
The \"overwhelming\" number of deaths during the bushfires was a catalyst for action.(ABC News: Maryanne Taouk)
", "\"There's not really much that can be done in those situations,\" Greater Sydney parklands environment manager\u00a0David Kirkland\u00a0said.", "The\u00a0deaths spurred the Greater Sydney Parklands and wildlife rescue service WIRES to look for ways to protect the megabats from future heatwaves.", "", "
Work to install the sprinklers was carried out at night while the bats were away feeding.(Supplied: WIRES)
", "More trees were planted to provide better shade\u00a0in regular roosting spots in Parramatta Park and nesting sites along the\u00a0Parramatta River site were closely monitored.", "Researchers are also experimenting with a sprinkler system to help cool the colony on hot days.", "", "
Thirty-six sprinkler systems are now in place on eucalyptus trees along the Parramatta River.(Supplied: Parramatta Parks)
", "Working through the night, while\u00a0the bats were up and flying, workers installed 36 sprinkler systems and 1,860 metres of piping to the tops of the eucalyptus trees along the Parramatta River.\u00a0", "\"We couldn't have just any kind of sprinkler, we didn't want to create mist and mess with the humidity, they still need to feel the heat to know to regulate their body temperature,\" Mr Kirkland said.", "Research scientist John Martin,\u00a0from the Taronga Conservation Society Australia, said the experiment was still in its early days.", "\"We haven't had any extreme heat days of over 42 degrees to really gauge the result,\" Dr Martin said.", "", "
Dr Martin says the experiment is still in the early stages.\u00a0(Supplied.)
", "The Bureau of Meteorology announced a La Nina alert in late October, forecasting a wetter-than-average spring and summer for northern and eastern Australia.", "Dr Martin said more was needed to be done to protect wildlife from catastrophic heat events in the future.", "\"We're talking about global action to reduce the frequency and intensity of heat stress events.\"", "The sprinkler system will be monitored by WIRES volunteers, who will be able to turn on the system in six of the tree\u00a0canopies using a mobile app.", "", "
Ms Taylor from WIRES welcomes the opportunity for her organisation to be involved.(ABC News)
", "WIRES chief executive Leanne Taylor said it could mean\u00a0the difference between life and death during\u00a0heatwaves.", "\"Flying foxes that are exposed to heat from extreme weather events, they die a slow and prolonged death. It's an unpleasant death.", "\"If this could be replicated in other camps it could result in saving tens of thousands of animals.\"", "", "
The absence of extremely hot days means the success of\u00a0the cooling system is yet to be tested.(ABC News: Maryanne Taouk)
"]
